result.execSummary:
The defendant Taneika Shanesa Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Restitution set at zero.  Pay all mandatory costs, fees, surcharges and assessments by the end of probation period or civil judgment to be entered.
No Contact with Jim B. or PLS Loan Store located at 4201 W. Capitol Dr.

Submit letter of apology to probation agent for Jim B. and Angelie M.
Participate in Anger management class.

Obtain an AODA assessment and Mental Health assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: STRAIGHT TIME with credit for 40 days time served.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Taneika Shanesa Brown not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Taneika Shanesa Brown not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a bail/bond hearing. Case adjourned in branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with PLS Loan, 4210 W Capitol Dr., and Jim B.

Defendant Taneika Shanesa Brown not in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Defendant Taneika Shanesa Brown in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered the USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON on penalty enhancer on COUNT 2 be striken.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY on COUNTS 1 and 2 and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.   Court found defendant guilty on COUNTS 1 and COUNT 2 and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Taneika Shanesa Brown in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Court reminds defendant that the No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
